techmeme.title: President Trump says on tariffs that "we're going to be announcing on semiconductors and chips" as soon as next week "because we want them made in" the US (Kevin Breuninger/CNBC)
The US General Services Administration approves OpenAI, Google, and Anthropic for AI contracts with civilian federal agencies via its Multiple Award Schedule (Bloomberg)
New York-based sales tool startup Clay raised $100M led by CapitalG at a $3.1B valuation, up from $1.25B in January 2025, and expects $100M in revenue in 2025 (Michael J. de la Merced/New York Times)
ElevenLabs launches Eleven Music, letting individuals and businesses use its AI model to generate music cleared for commercial use via English-language prompts (Belle Lin/Wall Street Journal)
Sources: Intel's 18A process is facing significant yield challenges, with only ~5% of chips meeting its specifications in late 2024 and ~10% by summer 2025 (Reuters)
